column4: how can i open my xorg.conf for editing? i opened it manually but it won't let me save, i figure i have to sudo cmd it, but I don't know the command
gksudo gedit xorg.conf
that comes up with a blank xorg.conf
what folder is xorg.conf in??
/etc/x11    i opened it manually with the viewer, it just won't let me save any changes
gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
yea i tried that too, blank document
i have a restart pending after today's updates, maybe I should restart first
run sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
yes, restart
want me to run the reconfigure anyway
before i restart?
that will give you an proper xorg.conf
just make sure you no how to setup your graphics before you do.
well i don't :)
like the memory it asks for
i'm gonna restart first
i wouldnt recommend it then.
still a blank xorg.conf
sorry i am out of ideas??
my xorg.conf is in /etc/X11/xorg.conf, so you should just have to, gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
